data.title: Add missing Array class reference documentation
Documented classes Curve*, Path*, and PathFollow*
data.body:
This is a split of #2347 .
I've added, some documentation for the classes Curve*, Path*, and PathFollow*. I tried to make them as detailed and "for dummies" as possible, but my wording might not be the best.
Anyone able to explain better, feel free to do so.

data.title: BBCode is now allowed anywhere in the inline documentation.
data.body:
This is a split from #2347 .
Previously, the inline help would not accept BBCode in places like the signal descriptions. Now, any string coming from the XML is assumed to be both BBCode and inline (does not generate a new block of text, nor does it change the formatting).

data.title: [BUG] OS.get_date().month returns worng month
data.body:
Win 8.1
Both 1.1 and alpha 2.0

When OS.get_date().month called returns the wrong month, the month returned is always bigger by 1 from actual one

data.title: Updated nrex with new features
data.body:
More updates incoming from https://github.com/leezh/nrex
- Added support for POSIX character classes `[[:alnum:]]`
- Added lookahead `(?=)(?!)` and lookbehind `(?<=)(?<!)` support
- Added ASCII `\xFF` and Unicode `\uFFFF` code points (in a style similar to Python)
- Added word boundary support `\b\B`
- Limited capture groups and back-references to 9 by default (for backwards compatibility)
- Quantifiers now use recursive functions. nrex::match() is now pure stack memory.
- Remembered to update the license in README.md to the newer zlib license

I've only tested the lib against the spec, so please do **double check this with proper real-world scenarios**.

Continues discussion from https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/pull/2300

data.title: [Discussion] - Unit Testing Framework
data.body:
Right now, there are some test applications and unit tests in the Godot tools application.  For example:

```
./godot-tools -test string
```

This is great but you have to run each test individually.  In addition, there are tests not even listed in the tools application under the help.  Some of the unit tests are broken and some are more general demo applications.  I think it would be nice to have a separate application built that only runs the unit tests and can run all of them with one call.  This would provide an easier way to write tests and possibly identify problems with Godot's growing codebase.

There are a wide variety of C++ libraries that handle unit tests.  Some of the more popular ones are:
- Boost unit tests
- [cppunit](https://wiki.freedesktop.org/www/Software/cppunit/)
- [GoogleTest](https://github.com/google/googletest)
- and more...

The benefit of using a library like this is that they're widely used and can be very powerful.  The downside, is that it's yet another dependency that needs to be installed by developers.

My proposal would be to use a unit testing library that is a header only.  This would mean it could be included in the Godot source code in the `drivers` folder.  I've been playing with [Catch](https://github.com/philsquared/Catch) ([Youtube demo](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C2LcIp56i-8)), a library that has these features and seems to be stable and maintained.  It's licensed under the Boost Software License.

So, what do people think?

data.title: projects in the editor_settings.xml that are no longer found on disk will be removed
data.body:
I was getting these errors in the console:

```
ERROR: _load_recent_projects: Condition ' err!=OK ' is true. Continuing..:
   At: tools/editor/project_manager.cpp:524.
```

The problem was that I had deleted projects on disk but they were still trying to be loaded from the editor_settings.xml file.  So, I changed it so that on load if it can't find a project it will remove it from the settings file and then make an immediate save at the end.

data.title: Crash without error in dev console when object remove itself from the scene tree
data.body:
Occurs in current head(6637a865187422b5b8303231dd43a38a5f5abd51) as well as 1.1
The worst crashes are those which don't give any output in developer console, and gdb dont help either since for some errors all he is telling is like "Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault. 0x000000000044aeb8 in ?? ()"

Anyway I reproduced one of these errors and it turns out in it's core it's very easy to reproduce:
1. Just call get_parent().remove_child(self);

Some output in devconsole on why game crashes would be nice. Especially that in real projects it usually will not to be so obvious since it can crash in calls similar to this one ("root/global").generateNextLvl(). 

**Also not sure if the project should crash in the first place, since I can imagine scenario when some objects might want to remove itself from the tree... Should I edit title/description to take this into account instead of no error in console?**

Some more observations:
The crash ocours not in the moment of removing itself from the tree, but when exiting from function call. I mean if generateNextLvl() have 300 lines it don't matter when we remove caller from the tree, crash will always occur when exiting from this function (after line 300 in this case). 

Sample simple project (really not sure if needed but just in case):
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/168251/godot/some/issues/SelfDeleteCrashWithoutError.7z

**EDIT:**
Backtrace from the crash from button that is removing itself from the scene on click:

```
Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x0000000000beeaea in Control::_window_call_input(Control*, InputEvent const&) ()
(gdb) bt
#0  0x0000000000beeaea in Control::_window_call_input(Control*, InputEvent const&) ()
#1  0x0000000000c014f2 in Control::_window_input_event(InputEvent) ()
#2  0x0000000000bec19a in Control::_gui_input(InputEvent const&) ()
#3  0x00000000006db200 in MethodBind1<InputEvent const&>::call(Object*, Variant const**, int, Variant::CallError&) ()
#4  0x0000000001464b8c in Object::call_multilevel(StringName const&, Variant const**, int) ()
#5  0x00000000014631b1 in Object::call_multilevel(StringName const&, Variant const&, Variant const&, Variant const&, Variant const&, Variant const&) ()
#6  0x0000000000b86ad8 in SceneTree::call_group(unsigned int, StringName const&, StringName const&, Variant const&, Variant const&, Variant const&, Variant const&, Variant const&) ()
#7  0x0000000000bb1832 in Viewport::input(InputEvent const&) ()
#8  0x0000000000bb38ed in Viewport::_vp_input(InputEvent const&) ()
#9  0x00000000006db200 in MethodBind1<InputEvent const&>::call(Object*, Variant const**, int, Variant::CallError&) ()
#10 0x00000000014639d1 in Object::call(StringName const&, Variant const**, int, Variant::CallError&) ()
#11 0x0000000001463131 in Object::call(StringName const&, Variant const&, Variant const&, Variant const&, Variant const&, Variant const&) ()
#12 0x0000000000b86d70 in SceneTree::call_group(unsigned int, StringName const&, StringName const&, Variant const&, Variant const&, Variant const&, Variant const&, Variant const&) ()

#17 0x000000000040ef80 in main ()
```

data.body: Bind FixedMaterial LightShader enum to use on scripting.

data.title: Fixed bug : both tab buttons appearing hovered
data.body: Fixed minor bug : quicklty pointing alternatively Script button and Close button on a tab showed both buttons as hovered

data.title: Godot crashes when I click on "X" scene close button
data.body:
Using latest git HEAD (commit 0a02c28).

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open one or several scenes. Each scene opens in a tab.
2. Click on an "X" close button to close a scene.

Actual behavior: Godot crashes and close it fully.

Expected behavior: Only the selected scene closes.

data.title: [Editor] Buttons for node edition suddenly disabled for all loaded scenes, except new nodes.
data.body:
After updating to current master at the time of writing (0a02c28b2be8e8271d5f3ffb95a4b09f91c3bd32), I loaded a scene in .xscn format, and noticed I couldn't delete/reparent/move nodes anymore, the interface buttons appear disabled.
![snapshot7](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/323651/10569485/f3fd9a22-7626-11e5-9c77-97d1c886c4ce.png)

Deleting the nodes using the Del key works, only the interface seems disabled.

When adding a new node to that scene, the buttons activate, so it seems to be just a problem with the user interface. I don't know the exact commit that broke the buttons, but seems it was since 1-2 days ago.

data.title: remove child variable that is duplicated from parent class
data.body:
Please double check but I think this is correct. :)
- The struct `NewLineNode` defines member variable with name `line` also defined in its parent struct `Node`.
- The struct `Surface` defines member variable with name `material` also defined in its parent struct `Geometry`.
- The struct `Surface` defines member variable with name `material_owned` also defined in its parent struct `Geometry`.

data.body: Not sure if you wanted another conditional check in there instead?  But at the moment, it's a duplicate.

data.title: float to bool variable type, fixes: #2478
LIGHT_SHADER_* constants not exposed to GDScript
data.body: The LIGHT_SHADER_LAMBERT and friends from the LightShader enum are not exposed in 1.1stable making it difficult to use FixedMaterial.set_light_shader without referring to the C++ source.

data.title: Tween can't properly animate Matrix32
data.body:
As said, `Tween` can't really animate Matrix32 transformations, but instead converts them into Matrix3.

I think the problem comes from [tween.cpp:407-409](https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/blob/master/scene/animation/tween.cpp#L408), where the `Matrix3` class is used instead of the proper `Matrix32`

data.title: Node2D::get_relative_transform not working as expected
data.body:
I was trying to do something, when I was (badly) surprised by the fact that `Node2D::get_relative_transform().get_rotation()` always returned 0. Soon I found out that the problem was a bit different...

When the tree structure is like (assume all nodes are `Node2D`s):

```
common_root
  some_parent_A
    node_A
  some_parent_B
    node_B
```

`node_A.get_relative_transform(node_B)` will error at [node2d.cpp:342](https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/blob/d3eb9e8c54d4a93b2bed90a5988f9814377d409f/scene/2d/node_2d.cpp#L342), and return `node_A`'s global transform instead.

Note: This can't be reproduced like:

```
common_root
  node_A
  node_B
```

, because then the `if` at line 343 would work properly.

data.title: Editor crash when closing any 3D scene via [x] button.
data.body:
Potentially related to #2622 but seems to have different behavior.

Version:
2.0 built from git after #2617 was merged.
X11 (Linux) 64bit

Observed behavior:
When multiple scenes are opened in the editor, closing any 3D scene via the new closing button will instantly crash the editor for me. There is no additional terminal output when started via terminal.

Expected behavior:
The 3D scene will be closed without affecting the editor when clicking the close button.

Steps to reproduce:
*Open any 3D demo project that comes with multiple scenes (like "Platformer 3D" for example).
*Open several scenes.
*Click the close button [x] on any 3D scene
*Observe editor crash

data.title: [2.0 Alpha] [BUG] [New scene system] Godot crashing after removing node from base scene when at the same time opened inherited scene
data.body:
Build (6637a865187422b5b8303231dd43a38a5f5abd51)
Basically Godot is crashing if we delete node from base scene at the time when inherited scene is opened. **Crash occurs when closing inherited scene**.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open base scene.
2. Open inherited scene.
3. Remove node from the base scene.
4. Save base scene.
5. Go to tab with inherited scene.
6. Close inherited scene tab with a "x" in the scene tab.

Short (20s) wid that illustrates the bug: https://youtu.be/ked8P39lsr4

data.title: VSync in Project Settings and script
data.body:
Most, if not all, game engines support the ability to toggle vsync on/off from within the system.  If I knew more about OpenGL I would definitely submit a patch, but unfortunately after spending a day trying to understand where to put the following in the Godot source I gave up:

[OpenGL - Swap Interval](https://www.opengl.org/wiki/Swap_Interval)

I know this will only affect Windows and Linux targets, but it's a real pain having the GPU burn unnecessarily just due to some simple switch.  I really wish I could do this myself, but so far I couldn't :( .

Edit: The ONLY way I could get Godot to do vsync was to force vsync globally in the Intel Graphics settings, which is not the most elegant solution since I have to turn it off again for some apps that do not like vsync forced on.

data.title: 3D CollisionShape scale tool widgets are slightly shifted
data.body:
CollisionShape node when scale tool gizmo is turned ON.
Little red dots used for scaling in axis, are a bit hard to hit, hitbox usually is a bit off from drawing.

data.title: Added low_memory_2d_mode
data.body: Added low_memory_2d_mode to indicate when 3D post processing buffers and viewport depth buffers should not be allocated.

data.title: Error or crash when opening inherited scene after editing base scene
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create new scene
2. Add Node, save & close
3. Create new inherited scene inheriting from just created scene
4. Add Node within the inherited scene, save & close
5. Reopen base scene, add another Node, save & close 
6. Observe issue when reopening inherited scene
